stance.audience: Apartment dwellers and suburban homeowners preparing for water outages
stance.promise: Pick safe water containers for 72 hours, 2 weeks, and 30+ days

claims_checklist: Include rotation doctrine: 6–12 months, label, drain/refill
Describe ergonomics: 55gal ≈ 460lb / 208kg; floor-load 40–50 lb/ft²; distribute weight
Compare stackables, 55-gal barrels, collapsible cubes, inflatable bathtub bladders
Include at least one forum or lived-experience insight
Use ≥3 authoritative citations and show Sources section

quotes.quote: Store at least one gallon per person per day for three days.
Emergency disinfection of drinking water can be done with household bleach or chlorine tablets.
Rotate stored tap water every six to twelve months.
A 55-gallon drum of water weighs roughly 460 lb (208 kg) when full.
Apartment preppers recommend stackable cubes to spread load and keep water under beds.
